You can call System.setOut to set destination for System.out.println. To
capture all output to System.out in a String write some code like this:
 
PrintStream saveOut = System.out;
try {
  ByteArrayOutputStream baos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
  PrintStream ps = new PrintStream(baos);
  System.setOut(ps); // Set System.out to capture output
  // Execute code that you are testing and that writes to System.out
  ps.flush();
  String capturedOutput = new String(baos.toByteArray());
  // Compare capturedOutput with the expected value
}
finally {
  System.setOut(saveOut); // Restore System.out
}
 
 

-----Original Message-----
From: Bob Koss [mailto:koss@...] 
Sent: Wednesday, November 28, 2001 4:51 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Capturing the standard out of a program that I'm
testing



Does anyone have any examples of code that captures the standard out of
a Java program.

I am trying to test a program that outputs using
System.out.print/println and I want to capture this output within my
test.




You can declare a String variable and examine it from your test that it
has the correct value.

Pass this string to println() and assume println() works.
